intro: Crotonogyne laurentii var. ikelembensis, commonly known as the Ikelembé croton, is a shrub native to tropical Africa, particularly Nigeria. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves with serrated margins. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in clusters, followed by orange-red, fleshy capsules as fruits. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in lowland rainforest understories. Due to its ornamental value and traditional uses, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and local landscapes.
